com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia.util

Class StopWatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia.util.StopWatch

  • public class StopWatch
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple stopwatch to keep a correct and updated record of the running duration of processes.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • StopWatch

        public StopWatch()

      • StopWatch

        public StopWatch(boolean processOnStartingThread)
        Parameters:
        processOnStartingThread - True if the repeating process should be handled on the same thread that created the Repeater

      • StopWatch

        public StopWatch(android.os.Handler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - The Handler to use for the repeating process

    • Method Detail

      • setTickDelay

        public void setTickDelay(int milliSeconds)
        Sets the approximate duration between time updates.
        Parameters:
        milliSeconds - The approximate duration between time updates [default: 33]

      • getTickDelay

        public int getTickDelay()
        Retrieves the approximate duration between time updates.
        Returns:
        The approximate duration in milliseconds between time updates

      • setSpeedMultiplier

        public void setSpeedMultiplier(float multiplier)
        Sets the multiplier to use when calculating the passed duration. This won't affect the tick delay setTickDelay(int) but will change the output for the current time.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - The amount to multiply the duration between each tick by

      • getSpeedMultiplier

        public float getSpeedMultiplier()
        Retrieves the current multiplier used for the current time calculations. NOTE: the default is 1
        Returns:
        The current multiplier

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the stopwatch. This will continue from where we last left off, if you need to start from 0 call reset() first.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the stopwatch, capturing the ending time

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the current time for the stopWatch

      • overrideCurrentTime

        public void overrideCurrentTime(long time)
        Forcefully sets the current time for the stopwatch.
        Parameters:
        time - The new stopwatch time in milliseconds

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Determines if the stopwatch is currently running
        Returns:
        True if the stopwatch is currently running

      • getTime

        public long getTime()
        Retrieves the current time for the stopwatch. If the stopwatch is stopped then the ending time will be returned.
        Returns:
        The time in milliseconds

      • getTimeInt

        public int getTimeInt()
        Retrieves the current time for the stopwatch. If the stopwatch is stopped then the ending time will be returned.
        Returns:
        The time in milliseconds

      • setTickListener

        public void setTickListener(StopWatch.TickListener listener)
        Sets the listener to be notified for each time update (tick)
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener or null
